overview_of_class:
Introduction to the vocabulary, techniques, and pleasures of literature through close study and discussion of poems, plays, short stories, and novels. Short critical papers develop ability to analyze and interpret literature. Learning objectives for the course include the student's ability to do the following:

Understand the distinctive characteristics of the major literary genres - fiction, drama and poetry - as well as an area of the humanities; recognize the basic elements of each genre and understand how they are integrated in particular works within each genre; understand standard literary terminology and use it correctly in the analysis of specific works of each genre; understand a variety of styles within each literary genre and be able to analyze their differences; develop critical skills and standards to evaluate individual works; appreciate and find personal value in literature.
name: Introduction to Literature
subject: ENGLISH
